column1: Satana is a city and a municipal council in Nashik District in the Indian state of Maharashtra. It is in the taluka of Baglan
column3: because of the city's dominance in the taluka. The name "Satana" may be derived from "Śāṭyāyani" one of the minor Upanishads of the Muktika canon.

column1: Satana is located at 20°35′37″N 74°12′00″E. It has an average elevation of 544 metres (1784 feet).
This tehsil includes historical forts like Tilwan
column3: Salher. Forest in Avati is famous in Nashik district.
551. Males constitute 52% of the population and females 48%. Satana has an average literacy rate of 75%
column4: higher than the national average of 59.5%: male literacy is 79%
column5: and female literacy is 70%. In Satana
column6: 12% of the population is under 6 years of age.
